title: An alternative to Futura Light?
content:
I'm searching for an alternative for Futura Light, I'm going to use it in all-caps display setting, so the lowercase is not important.

The criteria:

-Grotesque, geometric sans  
-Quite Light/Thin  
-N should have sharp, pointed verticles.  
-A should have a pointed top.  
-The bowl of P should be relatively large and the curve should be quite round.  
-Neutraface has a bit too much flavor and the whole family is too expensive.

I would really want to use something else than Futura for this

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/toronto-subway/regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312203859/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/toronto-subway/regular/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/toronto-subway/regular/") (not light enough)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/dhsans/light/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312203859/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/dhsans/light/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/dhsans/light/") (P isn't round enough)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/galapagos/contax/contax/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312203859/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/galapagos/contax/contax/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/galapagos/contax/contax/") (quite good, not enough. A bit heavy too, "too futura")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/olround-gothic/light/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312203859/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/olround-gothic/light/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/olround-gothic/light/") (too thin, I don't like the A)

Any suggestions?
author: Jan Sandvik
